title: Lesson 17
paragraph: Sports and fitness keep the body healthy and build teamwork and discipline. Activities from jogging to team sports like football or basketball require practice and training, while competitions and leagues give athletes goals to aim for.

words.meaning: a person trained in sports or physical exercise
words.example: The athlete broke the national record.

words.meaning: a racket sport played with a shuttlecock
words.example: They play badminton every Saturday.

words.meaning: a round object used in many sports
words.example: Pass the ball to your teammate.

words.meaning: a bat-and-ball game played between two teams
words.example: The baseball season starts in spring.

words.meaning: a team sport where players shoot a ball into a hoop
words.example: He practices basketball after school.

words.meaning: a combat sport where two people fight with fists
words.example: Boxing requires strength and speed.

words.meaning: a winner of a competition
words.example: She became the national champion.

words.meaning: a competition to determine a champion
words.japaneseMeaning: 選手権大会、チャンピオンシップ
words.example: The championship final was exciting.

words.meaning: a person who trains and guides athletes
words.example: The coach planned today’s training session.

words.meaning: an event where people or teams compete
words.example: Enter the competition to test your skills.

words.meaning: a marked area for sports like tennis or basketball
words.example: The match was played on an indoor court.

words.meaning: riding a bicycle for sport or transport
words.japaneseMeaning: サイクリング、自転車競技
words.example: She enjoys cycling along the coast.

words.meaning: physical activity to improve fitness
words.example: Daily exercise keeps you healthy.

words.meaning: a team sport played with a spherical or oval ball (context dependent)
words.japaneseMeaning: サッカー／フットボール
words.example: They watched the football match on TV.

words.meaning: the object of scoring in many sports or an objective to achieve
words.example: She scored the winning goal.

words.meaning: a sport where players hit balls into holes with clubs
words.example: They played golf on Sunday morning.

words.meaning: a place equipped for physical exercise
words.example: He goes to the gym three times a week.

words.meaning: a team sport where players pass a ball with hands to score
words.example: The handball team trained hard.

words.meaning: a sport played on ice or field with sticks and a puck/ball
words.example: Field hockey is popular in schools.

words.meaning: running at a slow, steady pace for exercise
words.example: She goes jogging every morning.

words.meaning: an organised group of sports teams that compete
words.example: The team joined the regional league.

words.meaning: a single game or contest between opponents
words.example: The match ended in a draw.

words.meaning: a metal award given for achievement in sport
words.example: She won a gold medal at the games.

words.meaning: a competitor or enemy in a contest
words.example: Respect your opponent in every match.

words.meaning: a person who takes part in a sport or game
words.example: Each player must wear a uniform.

words.meaning: a place filled with water for swimming
words.example: The pool is open to the public.

words.meaning: a competition of speed, often running or motorsports
words.example: They entered a charity race last weekend.

words.meaning: an official who enforces rules in a sport
words.example: The referee blew the whistle for a foul.

words.meaning: a contact team sport played with an oval ball
words.example: Rugby matches are very physical.

words.meaning: the action of moving quickly on foot
words.example: Running improves cardiovascular health.

words.meaning: traveling by boat using wind in sails
words.example: They enjoy sailing in summer.

words.meaning: to gain points in a game or the number of points gained
words.example: He scored two goals in the match.

words.meaning: gliding over snow using skis
words.japaneseMeaning: スキー、スキーをすること
words.example: They went skiing during the winter holiday.

words.meaning: to ride down snow-covered slopes on a board
words.example: He learned to snowboard last year.

words.meaning: a large sports arena with seating for spectators
words.example: The final was held in a packed stadium.

words.meaning: propelling the body through water
words.example: Swimming is good exercise for all ages.

words.meaning: a fast indoor game played with paddles and a small ball
words.example: They enjoy playing table tennis after school.

words.meaning: a group of players who play together
words.example: Our team trained hard for the season.

words.meaning: a racket sport played on a court with a net
words.example: She plays tennis every weekend.

words.meaning: practice to improve skill or fitness
words.example: Daily training improved his stamina.
